designScenario.name: Inertial Navigation System
designScenario.description: An advanced Inertial Navigation System (INS) leveraging MEMS-based accelerometers, fiber-optic gyroscopes, and adaptive Kalman filtering to deliver high-precision navigation solutions in GNSS-denied environments. Designed with fail-operational architecture, it integrates with aircraft control surfaces and supports AI-driven predictive fault management. Complies with DO-178C (DAL-A) and DO-326A airworthiness standards for safety-critical avionics systems.

details.description: Fuse data from MEMS accelerometers, ring laser gyroscopes, and magnetometers using adaptive Kalman filtering to maintain <0.1° attitude accuracy during high-G maneuvers.
Automatically compensate for sensor drift through celestial navigation alignment during cruise phases.
Process raw inertial measurements at 2kHz with <5μs timestamp synchronization across all sensor channels.
Deliver full navigation solution (position/velocity/attitude) within 8ms of sensor data acquisition.
Implement quadruple redundant sensor clusters with Byzantine fault tolerance for continuous operation during multiple concurrent failures.
Include self-test routines meeting MIL-STD-810H shock/vibration standards for inflight component validation.
Embed hardware-based TPM 2.0 modules for secure boot and runtime integrity verification of navigation algorithms.
Implement quantum-resistant encryption (CRYSTALS-Kyber) for all cross-bus communications.

systemComponents.name: Redundant Sensor Cluster
systemComponents.description: Fault-tolerant sensor suite containing four independent IMU pods with cross-channel validation

subComponents.name: MEMS Accelerometer Array
subComponents.description: Triaxial capacitive MEMS accelerometers with active thermal compensation (-55°C to 125°C operational range)

subComponents.name: FOG Gyro Assembly
subComponents.description: Fiber-optic gyroscope with <0.001°/hr bias stability and 2000deg/s dynamic range

systemComponents.name: Navigation Processing Unit
systemComponents.description: Multi-core safety-certified compute module with hardware-based matrix co-processors for Kalman filtering

subComponents.name: Adaptive Kalman Filter
subComponents.description: FPGA-accelerated sensor fusion algorithm with automatic process noise adaptation

subComponents.name: Redundancy Manager
subComponents.description: Voter mechanism comparing outputs from four parallel processing chains

systemComponents.name: Environmental Hardening Module
systemComponents.description: Active vibration damping and thermal regulation system maintaining sensor stability under extreme conditions

subComponents.name: Peltier Thermal Controller
subComponents.description: Solid-state temperature regulation maintaining IMU within ±0.1°C of setpoint

subComponents.name: MEMS Oscillator Array
subComponents.description: Atomic clock-synchronized timing reference with <1ppb frequency stability

relationships.description: Sensor cluster feeds raw inertial data to processing unit through quad-redundant FlexRay channels
Thermal controller maintains optimal operating conditions for MEMS sensors
Validated navigation solutions transmitted via ARINC 664p7 for flight surface actuation
Voter system aggregates outputs from four parallel Kalman filter instances

attributes.name: sensorBiasStability
attributes.description: Allan variance specification for accelerometer bias stability over operational lifetime

attributes.name: alignmentTime
attributes.description: Maximum time required for initial alignment on aircraft power-up

attributes.name: dataLatency
attributes.description: Maximum permitted latency from sensor measurement to navigation solution output

attributes.name: vibrationTolerance
attributes.description: Mechanical vibration resistance per DO-160G Section 8 certification

attributes.name: cryptoRefreshRate
attributes.description: Frequency of cryptographic key updates for secure data buses

comments.body: Fail-operational INS with MEMS/FOG sensor fusion and MIL-STD-810H compliance. Implements TPM 2.0 secure boot and CRYSTALS-Kyber encryption for ARINC 664p7 communications.
